metadata.title: CVE-2020-29130 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
slirp.c in libslirp through 4.3.1 has a buffer over-read because it triesto read a certain amount of header data even if that exceeds the totalpacket length.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-29130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslirp0 - 4.1.0-2ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libslirp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0-2ubuntu2.2').
